children.name: only one, or only a small number
only a1
children.definition: onlyonlyone person or thing, oronlya small number of people or things, and not anyone or anything else:chỉ
examples: there was only one dress that she really liked.
only rich people were able to travel abroad in those days.
you can only take one piece of hand baggage onto the plane.
you get only two chances - if you fail the exam twice you can’t take it again.
the only person/thing/place etc
she’s the only woman i’ve ever loved.

children.name: just b1
children.definition: just  only one person, thing, type, or group, or only a small number of them, especially when this is surprising:chỉ
examples: ‘were there a lot of people there?’ ‘no, just me and david.’
he started his own small shop - at first just selling newspapers, then books and magazines.
‘does everyone have to wear uniform?’ ‘no, just the first year students.’

children.name: one b2
children.definition: oneduy nhất
examples: one thing/person/time/problem etcthe only person, thing etc and no others - use this to emphasize that there really is only one person or thing of this type:
she was the one friend that i could trust
the one thing i don’t like about my car is the colour.
the one time i forgot my umbrella was the day it rained
sb’sone regret/friend/mistake etc
my one regret is that i never told brad how i felt.

children.name: all a1
children.definition: all the only thing or things, especially when this is disappointing, annoying, or surprising:
examples: tất cả
all kevin ever talks about is football.
we were really hungry, but all we could find was some stale bread.
all i wanted was a bit of sympathy.

children.name: nothing but u
children.definition: nothing but use this especially when you feel disappointed, annoyed, or surprised that something is the only thing there is or the only thing someone does:không gì ngoài
examples: there was nothing but salad to eat.
they did nothing but argue for the whole journey.

children.name: lone x
children.definition: lone being the only one, when usually you would expect there to be more - used innewspapersandliterature:
examples: a lone gunman burst into his house and shot him dead.
out of the stillness, a lone bird began to sing.
a lone survivor
he was a lonevoice(= the only person) arguing against a reduction in resources.

children.name: solitary c2
children.definition: solitary asolitaryperson, tree, building etc is the only one you can see in a place, and may therefore seem a littlelonelyorsad:đơn độc
examples: a solitary light shone in the street.
there was one solitary hotel left standing after the earthquake.
i could see a solitary figure outlined against the horizon.

children.name: sole c1
children.definition: sole  the only person, thing etc, especially when you would expect there to be more or expect it to be different:độc nhất, duy nhất
examples: everyone ignored my sole contribution to the conversation.
the sole person/thing etc :người/vật duy nhất
in many households, the woman is the sole breadwinner the only person who has a job.
with the sole intention/objective/aim of doing sth
i think he came here with the sole intention of causing trouble.
sb’s sole concern/objective etc
nasa’s sole concern was the safety of the astronauts.

children.name: exclusively c1
children.definition: exclusively made of, including, or involving only one thing or group, especially sth special or sth that is of good quality:độc nhất
examples: this shop sells clothes made exclusively of indian materials.
the office staff are almost exclusively female.

children.name: only a1
children.definition: only use this to say that a number, amount, price, size etc is surprisingly small:chỉ
examples: i got these four chairs for only $99.
we only have a very small garden.
‘is it far?’ ‘no, it’s only a mile away.’
she was only 17 when she got married.

children.name: just b1
children.definition: just only a small amount, number, period of time etc, especially when this is surprising and good:chỉ
examples: there is a beautiful park just 300 metres from the busiest shopping street.
it took the firefighters just three minutes to arrive.
his car hit a wall, but he escaped with just cuts and bruises.
just a little/ just a bit[uk spoken] only a small amount, number etc:chỉ một ít
‘do you take milk?’ ‘just a little, please.’

children.name: is that all? u
children.definition: is that all? say this when you are surprised because you expected a number, price etc to be higher: nhêu đó thôi à
examples: ‘the tickets are $10.’ ‘is that all?’
is that all the money you’ve got?

children.name: a mere b2
children.definition: a mere use this to talk about something that is only a small amount or figure, or is lower than you would expect:chỉ có,chỉ với
examples: a mere £50/three days/16% etc
you can now buy computers from a mere £300.
the crossword took him a mere six and a half minutes.

children.name: no more than x
children.definition: not/no more than use this to emphasize that sth is small, unimportant, difficult to notice etc:không nhiều hơn
examples: we were standing no more than 10 yards away from the scene of the crime and we didn’t realize it.
david watched the car drive slowly away, until it was no more than a speck in the distance.
there are beautiful mountains not more than ten minutes' drive away.

children.name: for one reason only and no other
only a1
children.definition: only foronlyone reason or purpose, and not for any others - use this especially when explaining why sb does sth:chỉ ( làm gì vì điều gì )
examples: she only married him for his money.
ms walker said she only started stealing because her children were hungry.

children.name: just b1
children.definition: just  only - use this when explaining why sb does sth:
examples: i think she just wanted someone to talk to.
i didn’t mean to interfere - i was just trying to help.
just because
just because he looked at them in the wrong way, they beat him up and stole his money.

children.name: merely b2
children.definition: merely use this to emphasize that you are doing sth only for the reason you say, and not for any other reason, especially when sb seemsannoyedorupset:chỉ là
examples: the committee does not blame any individual; we are merely trying to find out how the accident happened.
you are not there to teach, but merely to supervise the children.

children.name: purely c1
children.definition: purely for one reason or purpose only, and not involving anything else:hoàn toàn,chỉ là
examples: what we have is a purely business arrangement.
most plants are planted purely for decoration.
purely and simplyfor only one reason or purpose chỉ đơn giản là
they decided to close the museum purely and simply because it cost too much to run.

children.name: just b1
children.definition: just  use this to emphasize that sb or sth is not particularly important, special, or interesting: chỉ, duy nhất
examples: ‘what’s for dinner?’ ‘just pasta - nothing exciting.’
only/ just another
it’s just another one of those daytime talk shows.

children.name: only a1
children.definition: only use this to emphasize that sb or sth is not particularly important, special, or interesting: chỉ, duy nhất
examples: don’t ask me - i’m only the cleaner.
only/ just another
it’s only another one of those daytime talk shows.

children.name: merely b2
children.definition: merely use this to emphasize that sb or sth is not really important or special, although they may seem to be:chỉ
examples: the president’s position is merely ceremonial; it is the chancellor who holds real power.
i wondered if the girl had meant more to him than being merely a casual friend.

children.name: nothing else u
children.definition: nothing else only that, and not anything more important, more valuable, or more useful:
examples: she sees him as a friend and nothing else.
if nothing else
if nothing else the meeting serves as a useful way of getting everyone’s ideas together.

children.name: mere b2
children.definition: mere only - used especially when you do not expect very much from the thing you are describing, or you think it is unimportant:chỉ là
examples: how can you expect him to understand? he’s a mere child.
there have been reports that she is going to resign, but it’s mere speculation at the moment.
the mere mention of ronan’s name made her heart beat faster.

children.name: nothing but u
children.definition: nothing butuse this about sb or sth that is not nearly as good, special, interesting etc as they seem to be or pretend to be:
examples: they say they’re a moral, religious regime, but in fact they’re nothing but a bunch of bullies and thugs

children.name: no more than x
children.definition: no more thanuse this about sb or sth that is not nearly as good, special, interesting etc as they seem to be or pretend to be:
examples: as far as i can see, this proposal is no more than an attempt to disguise many of the mistakes management have made in the past

children.name: belonging or relating to only one thing, person, or group
only a1
children.definition: only chỉ
examples: the bee orchid is a rare plant normally only found in mediterranean climates.
women/men/ staff etc only
women only swimming sessions are held every thursday.
only for
high impact aerobics is only for people who are extremely fit.
these seats are only for first class passengers.

children.name: just b1
children.definition: just only affecting a particular group, place, time etc:chỉ ( cụ thể)
examples: it is a disease which affects just male child
sam mendes is highly regarded, not just in the uk.
just for
this class is just for beginners. why don’t you try the class next door?

children.name: be limited b2
children.definition: be limited/ restricted to  if sthis limited tooris restricted tosb or sth, it has been officially decided that only particular groups can do it or use it, or that it can only happen in particular places or situations: giới hạn
examples: access to the files is limited to management.
the cultivation of rice has to be restricted to areas of high rainfall.

children.name: be confined to c2
children.definition: be confined to to affect or happen to only one group of people, or in only one place or time: giới hạn
examples: so far, fighting has been confined to the capital city.
me or "yuppie flu', is not just confined to people in high-powered, well-paid jobs.

children.name: be unique to b2
children.definition: be unique to if an unusual or rare quality or characteristicis unique toa particular thing, person, place etc, only that thing, person, or place has it: duy nhất
examples: this type of tapestry work is unique to the region.
each set of genes is unique to the individual.
uniquely[adv]
there’s something uniquely english about the scene.

children.name: exclusive c1
children.definition: exclusive use this to describe something that only particular people have the advantage of having, doing, or using:độc nhất
examples: there will be exclusive coverage of the championship on channel 5.
the recent takeover gave rafferty exclusive control of the company
your password gives you exclusive access to your personal computer files.
exclusively[adv]
certain areas of the club are reserved exclusively for members.

children.name: be peculiar to c2
children.definition: be peculiar to to belong very definitely to one particular person, place, period of time etc and not to any other: đặc biệt của
examples: this way of grinding corn is peculiar to north american indians.
a gesture peculiar to himself
peculiarly[adv]
a peculiarly south african phenomenon it is only found in south africa
